faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain without restrictions, though some regions have foreign ownership limitations (Costa Blanca has none). You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), obtainable through your bank or Spanish consulate. Legal requirements involve property searches and notary verification, typically handled by estate agents and lawyers. Many investors complete purchases entirely remotely with proper legal representation.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-12% beyond the property price. These include transfer tax (6-8%, varies by region), notary fees (€500-1,000), legal fees (€800-1,500), and registration costs (€200-400). For this €175,000 property, expect total acquisition costs around €14,000-21,000. Some sellers negotiate cost-splitting. Financing mortgages through Spanish banks typically requires 30-40% deposit.

faqs.question: How much rental income can this property generate?
faqs.answer: This 1-bedroom apartment typically rents for €800 per week in holiday let markets, generating approximately €40,000 annually based on 50-week occupancy. Monthly rates average €2,000-2,500. Gross yield reaches 23%, though operational costs (cleaning, maintenance, platform fees) typically reduce net yield to 15-18%. Holiday rental demand remains strong year-round in Hondón de las Nieves due to established tourism and expat community.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is significantly lower than UK equivalents, typically 25-40% cheaper. Groceries cost roughly 30% less through Mercadona and Lidl. Restaurants offer €10-15 main courses or €12 menú del día lunch specials. Utilities average €100-150 monthly. Healthcare is affordable, especially through Spanish public system. This affordability maximizes investment property profitability compared to UK buy-to-let markets.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign investors can obtain Spanish mortgages through banks, typically requiring 30-40% deposit and proof of income. Interest rates currently range 3-4%, competitive with UK rates. Spanish banks increasingly serve international investors with English-language support. Some investors prefer cash purchases to avoid financing complexity. Mortgage approval usually requires 2-4 weeks with proper documentation.

faqs.question: Is Hondón de las Nieves suitable for holiday rental investment?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Hondón de las Nieves has an established tourism market with consistent demand year-round. The town attracts domestic Spanish tourists and international visitors seeking authentic experiences and beach proximity. faqs.question: What taxes will I pay on rental income from this property?
faqs.answer: Rental income is taxed at progressive rates (19-45%) through Spanish non-resident income tax. You can deduct expenses including mortgage interest, maintenance, cleaning, insurance, and platform fees, significantly reducing taxable income. Net yield after tax typically reaches 12-15%. Property tax (IBI) averages €150-200 annually. Many investors employ Spanish tax accountants (€300-500 annually) to optimize deductions and ensure compliance.

faqs.question: Why is this property cheaper than coastal alternatives?

Beachfront premiums reflect lifestyle factors rather than rental yield, making inland properties like this superior for purely investment-focused buyers.
